intro: Campanula graminifolia var. setifolia, commonly known as the slender bellflower, is a flowering plant native to parts of Europe and Asia. It is characterized by its upright growth habit and clusters of bell-shaped blue to violet flowers. The leaves are narrow and grass-like, giving the plant its species name "graminifolia," which translates to "grass-like." The variety setifolia distinguishes itself with its finely hairy stems and leaves. It thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows and woodland edges.
